snippet: The automaker is suffering from an excess of production capacity in a weakened European market. It said the plan would save $540 million in annual fixed costs.
abstract: French automaker Renault says it plans to cut 7,500 domestic jobs by 2016, or 17 percent of its French labor force, dealing another blow to France's already ailing industrial sector; Renault says cuts are part of adjustments to production capacity due to the crushing downturn of the European car market.

byline.original: By DAVID JOLLY and VINDU GOEL
byline.contributor: David Jolly reported from Paris and Vindu Goel from Detroit.

lead_paragraph: The automaker is suffering from an excess of production capacity in a weakened European market. It said the plan would save $540 million in annual fixed costs.

headline.seo: Renault to Cut 17% of Its French Workers
headline.main: Renault, Adjusting to Europe’s Declining Market, Will Cut 7,500 Jobs
headline.print_headline: Renault, Adjusting to Europe’s Declining Market, Will Cut 7,500 Jobs
